text.0: a thousand heads hath puruṣa a thousand eyes a thousand feet.
text.1: on every side pervading earth he fills a space ten fingers wide.
text.2: this puruṣa is all that yet hath been and all that is to be.
text.3: the lord of immortality which waxes greater still by food.
text.4: so mighty is his greatness yea greater than this is puruṣa.
text.5: all creatures are onefourth of him threefourths eternal life in heaven.
text.6: with threefourths puruṣa went up onefourth of him again was here.
text.7: thence he strode out to every side over what cats not and what cats.
text.8: from him virāj was born again puruṣa from virāj was born.
text.9: as soon as he was born he spread eastward and westward oer the earth.
text.10: when gods prepared the sacrifice with puruṣa as their offering.
text.11: its oil was spring the holy gift was autumn summer was the wood.
text.12: they balmed as victim on the grass puruṣa born in earliest time.
text.13: with him the deities and all sādhyas and Ṛṣis sacrificed.
text.14: from that great general sacrifice the dripping fat was gathered up.
text.15: he formed the creatures ofthe air and animals both wild and tame.
text.16: from that great general sacrifice Ṛcas and sāmahymns were born.
text.17: therefrom were spells and charms produced the yajus had its birth from it.
text.18: from it were horses born from it all cattle with two rows of teeth.
text.19: from it were generated kine from it the goats and sheep were born.
text.20: when they divided puruṣa how many portions did they make.
text.21: what do they call his mouth his arms what do they call his thighs and feet.
text.22: the brahman was his mouth of both his arms was the rājanya made.
text.23: his thighs became the vaiśya from his feet the Śūdra was produced.
text.24: the moon was gendered from his mind and from his eye the sun had birth.
text.25: indra and agni from his mouth were born and vāyu from his breath.
text.26: forth from his navel came midair the sky was fashioned from his head.
text.27: earth from his feet and from his car the regions thus they formed the worlds.
text.28: seven fencingsticks had he thrice seven layers of fuel were prepared.
text.29: when the gods offering sacrifice bound as their victim puruṣa.
text.30: gods sacrificing sacrificed the victim these were the earliest holy ordinances.
text.31: the mighty ones attained the height of heaven there where the sādhyas gods of old are dwelling.
